definition: to fiddle with sth/to trade with sth
pound/beat/hull/attack/disturb/stir
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
old variant of 鼓[gu3]

sentences.english: PSF: You prefer doing your work on your own in your studio?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢自己一个人在录音棚里捣鼓吗？

sentences.english: I have tried not to become too conscious of why exactly I came up with it.
sentences.chinese: 我已经试着让自己不要太在意捣鼓出这个书名的原因。

sentences.english: Working together with one or more people to put together a killer presentation?
sentences.chinese: 想要和几个哥们一起捣鼓出一个杀手级的演示文稿？

sentences.english: He fiddled about for few minutes, said the drain was okay and disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 他在浴室捣鼓了几分钟后说了声“好了”就走了。

sentences.english: Encourage your wealthy neighbors to buy new Cadillacs.
sentences.chinese: 捣鼓你的富邻居们买新的卡迪拉克。

sentences.english: I won't fly in that piece of reverse-engineered piece of rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 我决不会坐那个通过逆向工程捣鼓出来的垃圾飞机。

definition: to tinker with/to incite
to turn over sth repeatedly
to buy and sell/peddling
to move/to shift/to exchange/to buy and sell/peddling
to move back and forth/to fiddle with
to make a continual banging sound/(fig.) to provoke with words
to be really busy/pressing business
to move (things around)/to buy and sell at a profit (derog.)
to ponder/to mull over/to think through/Taiwan pr. [zhuo2 mo2]
to carve and polish (jade)/to polish and refine a literary work
to be busy (colloquial)
to look for/to explore/to probe
to push lightly/to flick to one side/to get rid of
to sweep/to brush away
to toss from side to side (e.g. sleeplessly)/to repeat sth over and over again/to torment sb/to play crazy/to squander (time, money)
to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
to fool around with/to mess with
to roll/to wander around/to appear repeatedly
